images.copyright: Aurora Australis over the Halley VI Research Station in Antarctica (© Stuart Holroyd/Alamy)
images.title: Southern lights for Antarctica Day
images.caption: Southern lights for Antarctica Day
images.desc: We’re marking Antarctica Day with the dazzling southern lights above Halley VI, the latest version of the six-decade-old Halley Research Station in the British Antarctic Territory. This modular building stands on hydraulic legs and can be moved using retractable skis. Antarctica’s harsh climate took its toll on the five previous facilities, Halley I - V, and each were decommissioned.
